conversations.content: Ifrit the Fellwyrm is known for his love of strength and duels. Warriors aspiring to greatness would do well to seek him out and challenge him to a bout.
A soldier from Kleifheim was one such contender. He fought Ifrit and was defeated, unable to claim the dragon's power for his own.
Ifrit was impressed by the soldier, however, and praised his efforts. ＂You are a man of great valor; of this there can be no doubt. I never imagined to meet a human like you.＂
＂But ultimately, you are but one human. If you are to fashion yourself a hero in this chaotic world, the time will come when you meet an unbeatable enemy.＂
＂On that day, turn to a flame and speak my name thrice. I will hasten to your side, and together we shall defeat your foe.＂
＂But remember this: I will face only one enemy. The strongest one. I have no interest in picking off hordes of weaklings should you find yourself surrounded.＂
The soldier, a naturally gifted warrior, was struck by the Fellwyrm's spirit. ＂I shall find you a satisfying foe,＂ he said, and resolved to call upon the Fellwyrm on that day alone.
The soldier to whom the Fellwyrm had taken such a liking soon became a general of Kleifheim. Twenty years passed. One day, without any warning, the sun blinked out.
The solar eclipse upended the balance of the mana and threw the laws of nature into chaos. All living creatures lost their power, while the dead rose up and walked the earth.
These rotting abominations advanced on Kleifheim. The soldiers did their best to fend them off, but there were too many; the mass of corpses stretched to the far horizon.
Just as they were starting to lose hope, the general hoisted his torch and shouted, ＂Ifrit! Ifrit! Ifrit!＂
Smoke billowed forth from the torch, and Ifrit was there. But when he asked to see his enemy and the general indicated the army of undead, Ifrit shook his head.
＂Have you forgotten?＂ asked Ifrit. ＂I will battle but a single foe.＂  The general cursed Ifrit, but his wife, calm beside him, pointed up to the dark skies.
＂Oh mighty Ifrit, our enemy is the very night itself. I implore you, find a way to drive it back!＂ This made the dragon chuckle, for he found it to be a worthy opponent indeed.
Ifrit bounded into the heavens and used his great strength to push the moon aside and reveal the sun. The army of undead crumbled to ash at once under its light.
＂I have defeated your foe, human,＂ laughed Ifrit. ＂And what a foe it was!＂ Satisfied, he turned and flew off into the distance.
